abstract.p: Board of Hyundai Motor Co, resisting orders from Chung Ju Yung, founder of Hyundai Group, to hire professional manager, votes to retain its chairman, Chung Mong Koo, who is eldest son of Chung family; vote comes one day after elder Chung said he and his other son, Chung Mong Hun, would cede management control of conglomerate as apart of major downsizing effort; photo (S)

block.p: Resisting orders from Chung Ju Yung, the founder of the Hyundai Group, to hire a professional manager, the board of an affiliate, the Hyundai Motor Company, voted to retain its chairman, Chung Mong Koo, left, who is also the eldest son of the Chung family. The vote came a day after the elder Chung said he and his other son would cede management control of South Korea's largest business conglomerate as part of a major downsizing effort.
